title: Colorado Election Clerk Indicted in Voting System Security Breach
sub_head: Tina Peters recently announced she was running for Republican nomination for Colorado secretary of state
body:
A Colorado county election clerk was indicted on a number of charges related to her alleged involvement in a voting machine security breach.
Mesa County Clerk Tina Peters, an election official who recently announced she was running for the Republican nomination for Colorado secretary of state, was indicted by a grand jury Tuesday on 10 counts. The grand jury also indicted her deputy, Belinda Knisley, on six counts.
